clinical_study.brief_title: User Evaluation of the Peristomal Skin Condition in Ostomates Using ConvaTec Moldable Technology™
clinical_study.official_title: Observational User Evaluation of the Peristomal Skin Condition in Ostomates Using ConvaTec Moldable Technology™

brief_summary.textblock: The primary aim of this study is to demonstrate the maintenance of healthy peri-stomal skin over a two month period in subjects who use ConvaTec Moldable Technology™ Skin Barriers as part of their standard protocol of care following surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Peri-stomal skin condition at 8-15 days following the application of the barrier.
primary_outcome.description: Using SACs scale to determine incidence and severity of lesions

secondary_outcome.measure: Peristomal skin condition in ostomates at 1 month (± 15 days) following the application of the barrier.
secondary_outcome.description: Using SACs scale to determine incidence and severity of lesions

secondary_outcome.measure: Peristomal skin condition in ostomates at 2 months (± 15 days) following the application of the barrier.
secondary_outcome.description: Using SACs scale to determine incidence and severity of lesions

intervention.intervention_name: Esteem Plus with ConvaTec Moldable Technology
Natura Accordion with ConvaTec Moldable Technology
Esteem synergy Plus with ConvaTec Moldable Technology

study_pop.textblock: Subjects with colostomy, ileostomy or urostomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who are 18 years old and older.
- Subjects who agree to participate in the evaluation and who have signed the informed consent form.
- Subjects presenting with a stoma (ileostomy, colostomy or urostomy).
- Subjects for whom ConvaTec Moldable Technology™ per package insert, within the context of routine clinical care is used as the first long-term (within 7 days of ostomy surgery) system following surgery and who have intact peristomal skin (healthy or SACs L1).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who, according to the investigator, have cognitive problems that prevent them from answering a questionnaire or for whom the evaluation could be a problem.
- Subjects who are in a simultaneous clinical evaluation.
